We need more than empty words and promises. We need more than thoughts and prayers.

The biggest expression of our love, security, and hope for our children is to pass legislation that will save their lives.

Eight years later, more than 100 Americans a day are dying because of gun violence. That violence has only been made worse by this pandemic.

Gun suicides have increased, children have more access to unsecured weapons, and domestic abuse is as deadly as ever.

We cannot forget what happened that day.

We cannot forget that we lost 20 children and have done little to make sure it never happens again.

We cannot forget that we still have not passed the legislation necessary to help protect our children and our families.

Eight years ago, we lost 26 beautiful lives to hateful and horrific gun violence at Sandy Hook Elementary. No parent, no family, should ever feel that pain.

We honor the memory of the children and educators taken from us. We must continue our fight to #EndGunViolence. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EpNtwV7XYAM_UJC.jpg
